alert.note: Alert for Marion; Monroe (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 5:40PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Monroe and southeastern Marion Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 540 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Albia, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail and additional heavy rainfall of one to two inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Monroe and southeastern Marion Counties, including the following locations... Lovilia, Hamilton and Bussey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
